3. How to tune µ, and its effect on the query results.
In my program, I used a very small µ (µ=0.001), which means the scoring formula is dominated by the count of matched terms, and less affected by not matched terms.
As what I learnt from Professor Chengxiang Zhai's work in SIGIR 2001: A Study of Smoothing Methods for Language Models, long queries perform better than title queries when µ is sufficiently large, but when µ is very small, it is the opposite.
Therefore, if we want to use long queries, we need to set a large µ, otherwise, if we want to use short queries, a very small µ will be helpful. And with a very small µ, the scoring formula will be dominated by the count of matched terms, while with a very large µ, it won't be obvious what terms will dominate the scoring formula, which will be determined by the document frequency and collection frequency.


4. Java version
My Java version is "1.8.0_221".
